result.execSummary:
The defendant William K. Garrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William K. Garrett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William K. Garrett was found guilty of 2nd Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution Hrg set for 12/2/22 @ 11:00am CC Iverson.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. 
* Pay restitution in the sum of $  TBD   plus surcharges. 
Perform  40    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization. May not have contact with victim, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William K. Garrett

records.addlTxt:
2:36 PM Defendant William K. Garrett in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for William K. Garrett.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  Request for restitution in the amt of $7,452.  RSH scheduled before CC Iverson 12/2 11am.  No objections to PSI.   Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 4 years with conditions; 253 days incarceration as a condition of probation with credit for 253 days served; costs ordered;  DE not eligible for CIP or SAP; DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court. Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Restitution hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Per 9/15/22 email received by court, DOC did receive the PSI but never sent to a supervisor for writer assignment.

Defendant William K. Garrett in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for William K. Garrett.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  PSI not filed by DOC - DOC indicated to court that they did not receive the efiled copy.  SEH rescheduled. Bond continued.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for William K. Garrett
Current: 4777 88th Avenue, KCDC, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2022)
Prior: 6024 14th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53143

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Barth.   Clerk HMcBride.  On state's motion, cts 2 and 3 are dismissed.  DE enters guilty plea to ct 1.  Court finds DE guilty of ct 1.  State requests PSI. So ordered. SEH 9/15 3pm.  Bond continued.

10:00 AM  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. DE appears by Atty Mike Barth.   Clerk P. Scypta.  
MINUTES:   Hearing set over to be heard before Br1 to allow Atty Barth to complete plea form.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Barth.   Clerk HMcBride.  No objection to DE's zoom appearance today.  PLEAH  6/10 10am. Bond continued.

Defendant William K. Garrett appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons  espicially firearms,  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Bradley O, Heather R, Prestige Apts 1600 60th Street  Kenosha.

130PM    Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.  $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  State moves to orally amend victim's name to Bradley O.M. in the beginning of the criminal complaint.  ts
